sponsor: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer
briefTitle: Study Evaluating a 13-Valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine in Healthy Infants
officialTitle: A Phase 3, Randomized, Active-Controlled, Double-blind Trial Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of a 13-valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine in Healthy Infants Given With a Meningococcal C-Tetanus Toxoid Conjugate Vaccine and Other Routine Pediatric Vaccinations in Spain
summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, tolerability and immunogenicity of a 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate (13vPnC) vaccine compared to Prevenar (7vPnC), when given concomitantly with routine paediatric vaccinations in Spain.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) Titer â‰¥ 1:8 in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose NeisVac-C Infant Series
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: One month after infant series dose (at 5 months of age)
